channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023100737
item.description:
Report X-2023100737

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED AND THE RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED. THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL, WEARING THE REQUIRED PPE. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING AND DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023100706
item.description:
Report X-2023100706

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX WITH HAZARDOUS SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZARDOUS DIAMOND LABEL WAS LEAKING AT THE PD 6 IRREG SPLITTER AREA. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE LEAKING BOX AND ALL RELATED MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023100445
item.description:
Report X-2023100445

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO DMP. DMP SENT A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND DECISION TREE. RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECISON TREE FOR CORRECT RESPONSE AND CLEAN UP. RESPONDER CORRECTLY CLEANED UP THE LEAKER AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO DMP FOR DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS CORRECTLY DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING ALL GUIDLINES.

item.title: Report X-2023100605
item.description:
Report X-2023100605

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was discovered damaged at the load trailer with an internal leakage. QA brought it to the QA cage for processing. DescribePack: Pkg had an internal leakage due to being cracked in the body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was processed and put in lined salvage drum in the hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a pacakge handler was loeading a trailer, he noticed that a pacakge was wet and hse told to his manager. DescribePack: One gallon got loose capm and spiplled out about 8 or more ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA went to the area and cleaned the spille, he put the pacakge in red tote line with a hazmat bag and brought to the processing caage.

Report X-2023100436

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING CLEAN UP RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE CONTAININGAEROSOL CANS. RESPONDER NOTICED THE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE LIMITED QUANTITY LABELS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. RESPONDER CALLED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED AEROSOLS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER 1ZE1383V0329938738

item.title: Report X-2023100300
item.description:
Report X-2023100300

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET ON THE SIDE AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE PROBLEM. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZBAG AND FOLD ABSORB. UPON ARRIVAL, THEY NOTICED THE HAZMAT WAS WET ON THE SIDE AND PLACED IT IN THE TOTE. DescribePack: THE CAP WAS DISCOVERED LOOSE AND LEAKED OUT THRU THE SEAL UNDER THE COVER. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023100286
item.description:
Report X-2023100286

  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was discovered in a load trailer with an internal leakage and brought to the QA cage for processing. DescribePack: The pkg was leaking probably due to being dropped by an unloader as 3 containers were cracked in the body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was put in a lined salvage drum and put in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100388
item.description:
Report X-2023100388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED IN LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE FOR APPRIATE CLEAN UP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED CLEAN UP PROCEDURE AND BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF BY RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2023100077
item.description:
Report X-2023100077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET SITTING BY A SUPERVISOR DESK ON OUTBOUND AREA. RESPONDER OPENED OUTER CARTON TO DISCOVER 5 GALLON BUCKET HAD LEAKED SMALL AMOUNT DUE TO VENTED CAP ALLOWING LIQUID TO FLOW OUT. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DAMAGE PROCESSING ARE IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.
